column2: WASHINGTON PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. This sign means:
column8: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 2. Drivers must report to law enforcement an accident involving an injury or death within:
3. When in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
column4: permissible to drink a moderate amount of alcohol when driving with a passenger.
column6: illegal to possess an open container of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column8: illegal to drink from, but permissible to transport, open containers of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column10: acceptable to drink alcoholic beverages if you are not driving.

column2: 4. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column4: that there's a school zone ahead.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column8: Cars in right lane must slow down
column10: Pass only in the right lane

column2: 6. This sign is a:
7. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column4: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.
column6: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.

column2: 8. Warning signs normally are:
9. The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
10. At an intersection with a roundabout, drivers should:
column4: stop in the intersection to yield to traffic on the right.
column6: always drive around the circle to the right.
column8: drive to the left of the roundabout when turning left.
column10: enter at any time, whether there is other traffic or not.

column2: 21. At a school crossing, drivers should:
column4: always stop, whether there’s a stop sign or not.
column6: watch for children and be ready to stop.
column8: None of the other answers is correct.
column10: always sound their horn and stay alert.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column6: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic
column8: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles

column2: 23. This road sign indicates that:
column4: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.
column6: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.
column8: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.

column2: 24. This sign means:
column8: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column10: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.

column2: 25. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.
column8: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
column10: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.

column2: 26. When a school bus is stopped off the road without flashing lights:
column4: stop until the bus moves on.
column6: stop only if you’re on the same side of the road as the bus.
column8: stop until the bus driver signals you to go.
column10: you’re not required to stop - use caution as you pass the bus.

column2: 27. A solid yellow line on your side of the center line means:
28. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.
column6: accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column8: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.
column10: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.

column2: 29. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
30. _________________ your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes.
column6: It is not recommended to check

column2: 31. A flashing yellow light:
column6: warns drivers to proceed with caution.
column8: can be found before reaching a sharp curve.

column2: 32. Speed limit signs are:
33. When parking uphill on a road with a curb, turn the front wheels:
34. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column4: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.
column8: The driver can legally pass red lights.
column10: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.

column2: 35. This sign means:
column4: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.
column8: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.
column10: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.

column2: 36. This road sign means:
column6: Pedestrians walking along the road ahead

column2: 37. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column4: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.
column6: pull over to the right and stop until the road is clear.
column10: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.

column2: 38. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
39. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
40. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column4: enter the intersection and then stop.
column10: slow down and enter the intersection.
